title: I told somebody who was running it down trolling from level 1 to go fuck himself
body:
I get a chat restriction, nothing happens to him. Hes a hard stuck d5 player who saw my smurf was almost d5 so he legit ran it down, pressed no on every surrender vote, and kept saying why I was mad in chat.
And you wonder why this game is in the gutter when riot literally does nothing about hard inters. I should have left the game legit nothing would have happened to me and I would not wasted anymore time stuck in a game with a troll.

replies.body: I get that it is annoying, but telling a troll to fuck themself will never make them stop.

This game is in the gutter because people like you forgot the golden rule of the internet: Don't Feed The Trolls. 

One more int feeder got exactly what he wanted.

> [{quoted}](name=Jo0o,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tZKjqJOZ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-11-03T16:36:00.356+0000)
>
> This game is in the gutter because people like you forgot the golden rule of the internet: Don't Feed The Trolls. 
> 
> One more int feeder got exactly what he wanted.

Or maybe get this- cuz people like you are blaming the victim.
The troll wanted to lose OP's game cuz he saw he was in promos. Even if OP kept his mouth shut the troll would get what he wanted. Pls don't comment on stuff like this, you don't provide anything useful to this and you're just making people like OP even more frustrated. 

And to OP: sry that happened to you. File a ticket, maybe a Rioter bans him.
They weren't the victim. They were another perpetrator the second they started breaking rules themselves.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tZKjqJOZ,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-03T17:15:26.963+0000)
>
> They weren't the victim. They were another perpetrator the second they started breaking rules themselves.

Oh yea. I'm pretty sure it's OP's fault some1 trolled in his game. And I'm pretty sure OP would be toxic if he didn't have that player on his team. (sarcasm btw)

Even if he 'broke the rules', there is no need to shit on him even more. Instead, give him some actual advice on how to approach the situation he was in so he knows for the next time it happens to him

> Oh yea. I'm pretty sure it's OP's fault some1 trolled in his game.

It's not OP's fault that someone trolled his game.

It _is_ OP's fault that he broke the rules and got punished for it.

We aren't victim blaming, we're straight-up telling the guy: _Retaliation doesn't help, and it is very much punishable._

> Instead, give him some actual advice on how to approach the situation he was in so he knows for the next time it happens to him

Here's the advice: **_Don't feed the trolls._** It may not stop them from trolling or feeding, but _not flaming them_ is still hurting them 'cause you're not giving them the satisfaction of a response.

It's literally Internet 101. Most people on the internet know - whether they adhere to it or not - that simple rule.

But, nah, let's just call Jo0o an asshole and a victim blamer for point-blank explaining the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=Umbral Regent,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tZKjqJOZ,comment-id=00000000000000000002,timestamp=2018-11-03T17:28:42.218+0000)

> 
> But, nah, let's just call Jo0o an asshole and a victim blamer for point-blank explaining the problem.

Have you read what OP said?

The troll wanted to lose the game cuz OP was in promos. IT WAS LITERALLY HIS GOAL. and he would get it regardless of OP's actions. And Jo0o is literally telling the guy 'This game is in the gutter because people like you'.

If that's not blaming the victim, I dunno what is..

> Have you read what OP said?

I have read it. Doesn't change my opinion in the slightest, no matter how many times I re-read it.

> The troll wanted to lose the game cuz OP was in promos. IT WAS LITERALLY HIS GOAL. and he would get it regardless of OP's actions.

And lashing out and giving the troll _more_ of what he wanted would help......How?

I don't understand how you're not getting this. Retaliation DOES NOT HELP. **It is NOT worth it to put your account at risk for the short-lived gratification of telling a troll, _who legitimately does not give two shits, a fuck, or a rat's ass_, to fuck off.**

The troll is not going to magically stop trolling for any reason. If you don't feed them, they're still going to troll, but if you do feed them, they're just dragging you down with them. It's a lose/LOSE situation, and frankly, I'd rather take an L in a promo series because of a troll than take an L _and_ get chat restricted, making the whole ranked climb pointless.

> And Jo0o is literally telling the guy 'This game is in the gutter because people like you'.

Because the OP is saying "this game is in the gutter because x" to blame someone else for their own shortcomings. He's making outrageous claims that Riot does nothing about intentional feeders, and trying to excuse his poor behavior by saying "I had a feeder in my game, I should be allowed to say whatever I want, fuck the rules!"

Frankly, Jo0o picked the harsh wording well, and I honestly agree with him. No need to mince words. People who think it's okay to flame and retaliate and act like they get a free pass to break the rules **do not belong.**

> If that's not blaming the victim, I dunno what is..

The OP is not a victim. They retaliated, they flamed, they broke the rules - they don't get to play the victim card. They're another perpetrator. If they didn't flame? _Then_ they'd be a victim. But, they did, so they aren't.

They literally could have just not typed anything to the troll, and would not have been punished.

It's not his fault someone trolled.

But it is his fault that he decided to flame, turning one person into two, making the game even worse for the rest of his teammates.

If someone is actually a legit troll, what is saying "no, stop it" going to do? Getting a rise out of people is exactly what they want.
